headline: Airstrikes on Iran: How the US and Israel hope to bring down the regime
description: The goal of the US-Israeli strikes is ambitious. The top target on their list was Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, whose death was confirmed by Iranian state media on Sunday. Donald Trump and Benjamin Netanyahu have also targeted the country's ballistic missile capabilities.

headline: Ali Khamenei, Iran's supreme leader and symbol of a repressive regime, has died
description: The successor to Ayatollah Khomeini in 1989, Ali Khamenei embodied the Islamic Republic, setting its political course both domestically and abroad. Over the course of his rule, and faced with the country's isolation, he chose to harden the regime and brutally repress any dissent. He died on Saturday, February 28, at the age of 86.

headline: Bombings in Iran raise fears of oil crisis
description: The closure of the Strait of Hormuz and US-Israeli strikes in Iran are reigniting the specter of a surge in crude oil prices. But the global economy is less vulnerable today than it was during the 1973 oil crisis.

headline: Iran's state media say 100 killed in strike on girls' school
description: Footage broadcast by state media shows the rubble of a girls' school in Minab where 108 people were reportedly killed, according to Iranian press reports. Tehran has accused the US and Israel of an 'atrocious crime.'

headline: Attacks on Iran: US and Israel are committing 'a crime of aggression,' says Bernie Sanders' former adviser
description: An influential voice in the progressive camp and former advisor to Senator Bernie Sanders, Matthew Duss harshly criticizes Donald Trump's actions following Saturday's strikes, stating that 'this war is unfortunately the culmination of decades of a militarist foreign policy.'

Rwanda: Claude Muhayimana sentenced on appeal to 14 years in prison for complicity in genocide
description: The Paris criminal court sentenced the former street sweeper from Rouen to 14 years in prison for transporting militiamen to various massacre sites in April 1994.

headline: Five Paris restaurants serving mouthwatering ramen
description: A staple of Japanese cuisine, this noodle soup takes on subtle flavors depending on whether it is made with pork, fish or vegetables. Here are our picks for the best places to enjoy excellent ramen in the French capital.

headline: Ukraine: 'The war could still last for years and paradoxically, time is not on the Kremlin's side'
description: Researcher Dimitri Minic tells Le Monde in an interview that it is 'too soon to write off Ukraine,' even though the balance of power currently favors Russia.

headline: Trump's war of choice in Iran
'The Louvre director's resignation raises an old question: Why do cultural execs go mad?'
'The Epstein scandal is astonishing by the scale of the complicity and rape culture at the top of society'
